itemDescription: English interior designer and antiques dealer

wikipedia_page.main: Sonia Annabel Elliot (née Shand; born 2 February 1949) is an English interior designer and antiques dealer. She is the mother of British Conservative politician Ben Elliot, who serves as the Co-Chairman of the Conservative Party, and sister of Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, a member of the British royal family.

response: By 1987, cracks in their marriage had become visible and the couple's unhappiness and cold attitude towards one another were being reported by the press. In 1989, Diana was at a birthday party for Camilla's sister, Annabel Elliot, when she confronted Camilla about her and Charles's extramarital affair. These affairs were later exposed in May 1992 with the publication of Andrew Morton's book, Diana: Her True Story. The book, which also revealed Diana's allegedly suicidal unhappiness, caused a media storm. In 1991, James Colthurst had conducted secret interviews with Diana in which she had talked about her marital issues and difficulties. These recordings were later used as a source for Morton's book.

Camilla Rosemary Shand was born at King's College Hospital, London, on 17 July 1947.Graham, p. 9Some sources report that she was born in Plumpton, but it seems that this is a confusion of her childhood home with her birthplace. She grew up in The Laines—an 18th-century country house in Plumpton, East Sussex—and a three-storey house in South Kensington, her family's second home. Her parents were British Army officer-turned-businessman Major Bruce Shand and his wife Rosalind, the daughter of Roland Cubitt, 3rd Baron Ashcombe. She has a younger sister, Annabel Elliot, and had a younger brother, Mark Shand. One of her maternal great-grandmothers, Alice Keppel, was a mistress of King Edward VII from 1898 to 1910. On 1 November 1947, Camilla was baptised at Firle Church, East Sussex. Camilla's mother was a housewife, while her father had various business interests after retiring from the army. He was most notably a partner in Block, Grey and Block, a firm of wine merchants in South Audley Street, Mayfair, later joining Ellis, Son and Vidler of Hastings and London.

Shand was born on 28 June 1951, as the son of Major Bruce Shand (1917–2006) and his wife, the Hon. Rosalind Maud Cubitt (1921–1994), daughter of the 3rd Baron Ashcombe and the former Sonia Rosemary Keppel, daughter of Alice Keppel. He was the brother of Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, and Annabel Elliot.

link_mentions.page: British Association for Adoption and Fostering
response: BAAF's President was Rupert Hambro. Patrons included: Elizabeth Butler-Sloss; Nicky Campbell, presenter of BBC Radio 5 Live, who was adopted; hairdresser Andrew Barton; interior designer Annabel Elliot; Clare Grogan; and Nimmy March.

Elliot is the son of Simon Elliot, a Dorset landowner, and Annabel Elliot (née Shand), an interior designer and antiques dealer. He has two younger sisters, Alice and Catherine. His mother is the sister of Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, and Mark Shand. His maternal grandparents were Major Bruce Shand and the Hon. Rosalind Cubitt.
* Annabel Elliot, English interior designer and antiques dealer, sister of Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall
